name: atticusonline
text: Jeez, mine is set to 10....I figure that 10 lames should be enough to redeem yourself. But if people are still laming you after that, then you deserve it. Likewise my Chubby limit is at 25, reserved for the really good stuff.

name: soticoto
text:
You do like to say the most retarded things, don't you? Probably reckon the ad populum fallacy is a valid technique for winning an argument, don't you? Probably reckon that women who get gang-raped deserve it because the rapist majority reckons they do, don't you?

Facts as be, some of the best content posted on Assetbar is the stuff that is lamed to hell and beyond. It isn't that they deserve it, but that they dare to go against convention... to defy the metagame. To do other than what the hundreds of other folk are doing.
That makes them so much better in my books.

name: pogo
text: Looks like the lynch mob has dispersed, or forgot how to read.  I'm 50/50 on the GOF, but I have preordered the book 'cuz I want Onstad's baby to have diapers.

name: apricotta
text: Chubby for not fearing to voice your opinion about GOF.

name: invidious
text:
Quote:
Tell me what the hell was funny about 20-something strips fawning over how much of a badass Ray is? I get it already.


Actually, based on that quote I don't think you do. The Great Outdoor Fight was NOT about how much of a badass Ray is, but rather about how deep and strong Ray and Beef's friendship is. Also, you act as if the one and only purpose of this comic is to provide laughs. Wrong again. Certainly Onstad's written many things funnier than the Great Outdoor Fight, but few could surpass the GOF in terms of the depth they added to Achewood character development and character relationships.

name: dartigen
text: And GOF most definitely did not jump the shark, at least not in my definition of 'jumping the shark'.

name: nsrdude
text: Ray has a sense of achivement not equalled often in everyday life. I feel Ray is fine with himself. More people should take stock of what they have made.

name: lowercasejim
text: The Charlie Hustle haircut makes the robot look like Death Wish, potentially harshing a buzz.

name: odvo
text: My feelings on this strip are: positive.

name: side_show
text: A comment left by side_show was marked as spam and excluded. side_show: What a douche. (reported by dianahamilton, mira, infodesk06)

name: jhunt
text: Man, I hope you're right.  That shirt is a vital part in a recipe for Summer shenanigans.  Crucial!

name: ctrl-s
text: WHAT IS THAT ABOUT "THE DIORAMA"?  I know a diorama is a 3D representation of a scene, but I totally don't get the reference to "major religious thinkers [coming] out against [it]" in the Cornelius panel, if indeed there is anything to "get" and if it's anything other than another absurd little joke.  HELP.

name: prius_chaser
text: It's a joke about religions coming out against all manner of stupid crap, like Harry Potter or tits. It's funny to think of the church deciding that dioramas represent a direct threat to morality. To me.

name: misterwolf
text: Yes, exactly, I thought this was hilarious. Also that it was such a long time ago that this is the worst thing that serious men of faith could find to complain about in popular culture.

name: billyamericana
text: It may also have something to do with Ray not really knowing about religious terms and confusing "diorama" with "diocese" or some other actual church phrase. But it could be both, neither, or something else, really - major religious figures railing against "the diorama" IS hilarious... and quite possible given the current environment in America... *sigh* sometimes I hate this place.

name: ctrl-s
text: I love Ray's satisfied/stoned half-smile.

name: jesseadam
text: why is Ray the only one wearing a shirt?

name: misterwolf
text: Dog, Cornelius is dressed to the nines, and there is no emperical evidence on Beef. Tedore seems to have some sort of emblem on his chest, though this could possibly be a tatoo or some sort of trendy tribal ritual scarification.

name: madnes
text: It's a T.

name: misterwolf
text: In any event probabally a "T" on a shirt, is my point.

name: thomasedison
text: It is in honor of this strip that I spark up and head to the field.

name: misterwolf
text:
Congradulations, Mr. Onstad. You have figured out how the game of baseball might be made marginally bearable.

Also, those dioramas are flithy, heathen idols. A trap for the young, and a thorn in the side of the righteous.

name: molesticide
text:
the best part is that he calls vlad "the robot."

also, i am overjoyed to note that the team name "stoned lightning" is remarkably similar to "mahogany thunder," which is my hittin' piece, so named for its classy wood finish and stiff punch below the sternum that it delivers, as though a sudden thunderclap, upon inhalation.

it's good to see cornelius getting his nebria on, and in the same strip as todd! both of my favorites, stoned on a baseball field. what a rare and delightful occurrence!

name: ian
text: you guys are right

name: austinmayor
text:
I love you Chris.

But not in a gay way.

Well, not just in a gay way.

name: supernintendochalmers
text: oh man pete rose hair

name: niggar
text: What everyone is saying about Cornelius is correct. He would do well to have his own inner monologue in a following strip; getting him stoned is quite a development for his character.

name: mattydread
text: This is something I would want to try.  Coincidentally, all my friends know how to grill.

name: qingofchina
text: This has evolved into my dream since I was 12. First it was baseball. At 16 it became stoned. at 18 it had a GRILL! YES!

name: bigdumbtravface
text:
Onstad has my personal permission to jump whatever sharks he so desires. This idea is infuckincredible.
I'm doin' it.

name: woodenteeth
text: Jumping the shark should be literal... and an olympic sport.

name: mira

text: Whosoever uses the phrase 'jumping the shark', under whatever circumstances, needs to think about where their life took a wrong turn.

text:
So.
Many.
One.

Com.
Ments.

name: scotish_arab
text: Roast Beef is the Id, true that.

name: helmstreet
text: I think he's more my ideal ego. He has waaaay too many inhibitions to be the id, way too much fun to be the super ego. I'm gonna stick with ideal ego. Any Freudians in the house wanna weigh in?

name: patiently56
text: stoned league softball would be much more fun than beer league softball.

name: epicurus
text:
I dig this strip, next time I am high I will no doubt start to list my "strange cares" and the ways the are strange in a mellow tone.

Re: the Great Outdoor Fight, it was not a shark-jumping in my opinion. It could easily have been a disaster but I think Mr. Onstad pulled it through nicely, especially by keeping a tight hand on how much "fighting" was shown in the arc.

name: syrinx
text: "Strange cares" is such a succinct way to sum up RB.  Also, good band name.

name: deancain29
text: Awesome-bot.

name: phoenixultima
text:
"That's fine, 'cause that's okay."

I don't know why I like that line so much, but I do. There's just something... right about it.

name: ixmucane
text: This is the line I am most want to and am likely to find a situation to actually use in since "because of a problem?"

name: oishii
text:
I like how Vlad becomes "the robot" in this strip.

I also like how people can only speak their minds when they are saying something positive or using the word "awesome", lest they be lamed into hiding.

name: takepills
text: "that's fine, 'cause that's okay." is officially going into use in my life

name: cpnglxynchos
text: panel four made this for me.

name: tad-
text: "I need them to remember: 'The cat in the glass is Beef'"

name: fatcat
text: A Pete Rose bot is fine because it is okay.

text: too bad the robots cant get stoned.

text: I like how Roast Beef's area has a sign with his name on it. because we need to know that it's him .
